think?" with Professor Feiman. As a freshman concentrating in Cognitive Neuroscience and Computer Science, this position is an amazing opportunity to utilize my academic background and passion for linguistics and cognitive science to investigate human communication, which will further my goal to explore the field of clinical psychology.

developed a solid foundation in Python and Java, which will allow me to quickly learn any computational aspects of the research. Furthermore, my experience working with children as a violin teacher and camp counselor has given me valuable insight not only into how to positively interact with children, but also into their thought processes and unique perspective of the world. This knowledge will allow me to better understand and facilitate their language-learning process while working with them.

My strong organizational and project management skills, demonstrated by creating and running a multi-branch club in high school and serving in various leadership roles at Brown, will be instrumental in contributing to the efficient and effective management of the project. My intellectual curiosity and passion for independent learning ensures that I approach all tasks thoroughly and thoughtfully.

drives me to understand the intricacies of language acquisition and the connection between language and our perception of the world. This internship presents a unique opportunity to explore these interests further. I’ll investigate this phenomenon at its root: as children don’t have much information about the world, I’ll discover firsthand how they acquire and process information, while guiding them and their development to become better people. Finally, I strongly believe in the importance of communication for human happiness and function. Investigating language and cognition through this project will provide invaluable insights into the mechanisms of human communication, something beneficial not only for my own life, but for the life of every human being.

I am confident that my passion for psycholinguistics, skills, and background make me a strong candidate for this project. Thank you for considering my application, and I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how I can contribute to this team. I can best be reached at my email athena_deng@brown.edu.
